_header: Seek to defend thyself from sin
_description: On the Seven Deadly Sins — seven quatrains and concluding 6-line stanza

BLAdd17013.First Lines:
Seeke to defende thy selfe from synneSo maiest thow lyve in happie
                    daies…
BLAdd17013.Last Lines:
…In Burning stil he can not dyeBecause he dothe no thinge but
                    ly
BLAdd17013.Attributed Title: and here begynethe the seuen dedly synnes (f. 5)
BLAdd17013.Editions:
Francis,  Winthrop Nelson,
                        ed.  
             The Book of Vices and Virtues: A Fourteenth-Century English Translation
                of the Somme le Roi of Lorens d’Orleans.
EETS
         o.s. 217 (1942); repr. 1987: 340.
